I'm kind of curious. Have other people doing the trial stopped showing up?
I am not at liberty to violate provider-patient confidentiality.
\.\.But over half our original participants have missed their appointment date and become ineligible to continue.
Yeah. Doesn't surprise me at all.
The trial sponsor, Neurosena, anticipated this fallout and tried to cast a wide net.
They didn't require an ADHD diagnosis; merely suspected ADHD, as is the case with you, was sufficient to qualify.
Okay, but if they wanted a successful trial, maybe they should have thought about how ADHD works?
Give us a few appointment reminders. Call. Text. E-mail.
Give us 500 halfway through and 500 at the end so there's a reward sooner.
Schedule us a taxi to and from the clinic if you want us to show up.
Well, I guess that's me specifically, 'cause I can't drive.
I hear you. I'm not in charge of the protocol for trial participants.
I assure you my regular patients receive plenty of reminders.
And I can assist you with transportation vouchers since you're on federal health insurance.
No, I'm fine. The bus is...\.\. well, there's a bus, and it runs sometimes.
I've been making it so far. My point was more so for other people.
It's hard to navigate the medical system in general. That's all.
And so wouldn't it be great to have to navigate it less frequently?
To have a medical implant that lasts for six months?
To not have your prescription denied at the pharmacy because it's day 29 instead of day 30?
That's what I'm hoping this sponsor will make possible.
Even if the CEOs in the ivory towers of privatized healthcare never step foot in a low-income clinic in their life.
Even if how they conduct their trial makes little real-world sense.
They're funding it, so they call the shots, basically.
"Stop shooting the messenger" is what you mean.
I welcome feedback. I want to know what you think.
Some of my patients more heavily on the "H" side of ADHD are refreshingly honest about their experiences.
Yeah. I know the type. Zero filter.
No point in filtering when it comes to certain subjects.
Like the medical system? Because it's bullshit?
Those are your words, not mine.
The medication will have been in your system for one month this time next week.
You may feel more pronounced effects from this point forward.
Okay. Sorry I was late. I dunno if I said that this time yet.
Don't worry about it. I will see you in one week.
